summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2019 between attorneys representing alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein and a federal prosecutor. The emails discuss scheduling interviews for two clients and inquire about the status of the criminal investigation following Epstein's death. The attorneys also ask if their clients appear in photographs seized from Epstein's home.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Attorney copied on emails regarding victim reports against Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier who is the subject of the criminal investigation for alleged assaults in 2004.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Interview
events.description: An in-person interview is scheduled between federal prosecutors and an alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein, to be accompanied by attorney Arick Fudali.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Video Conference
events.description: A video conference interview is scheduled between federal prosecutors and an alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein who is located in a different time zone.

events.title: Alleged Assaults by Epstein
events.description: The attorneys state their clients believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein passed away in jail over the weekend prior to August 12, 2019. The attorneys inquire about the status of the investigation following his death.

keyFacts: Attorneys for alleged victims are coordinating with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to schedule interviews following Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The alleged assaults by Epstein are said to have occurred in or around June 2004.
The attorneys provided photographs of a client from 2004 and asked prosecutors to confirm if she appears in any photos seized from Epstein's home.
The criminal investigation was ongoing as of August 2019, with a focus on Epstein's potential co-conspirators.
The email chain shows active legal coordination between victim attorneys and federal prosecutors shortly after Epstein's death.
